title: Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site: Archive
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases     Archive                Archive           Subscribe  | What is RSS     August 12, 2015  Celebrate Women's Equality Day 2015  TUSKEGEE, AL– On Wednesday, August 26, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site will celebrate Women’s Equality Day. The theme for 2015: “The Many Faces of Josephine Baker” highlights the many facets of Josephine Baker’s life and career.   May 22, 2015  48th Annual Memorial Day Weekend Fly-In  Don't miss this spectacular, 2-day family event at Tuskegee's historic Moton Field.  This year's event pays a special tribute to the "Legends of Aviation."   April 27, 2015  Economic Benefit from Tourism to Tuskegee National Historic Sites  Tourism to Tuskegee Institute and Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Sites create $1,935,100 in Economic Benefit; Report shows visitor spending supports 33 jobs in the local economy   December 04, 2014  Life After Tuskegee  They came to Tuskegee and became pilots. As Tuskegee Airmen, they served overseas to fight the Axis powers and became legends. Upon their return home, some went on to become leaders in their communities   October 25, 2014  Celebrating Veterans Day 2014  In honor of all who served in the United States Armed Forces, the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site will host a Veterans Day program on Tuesday, November 11, 2014 at 11:00 a.m.   August 29, 2014  Youth Airplane Building Workshop  Building a model airplane is a simple pleasure. On Saturday, August 30, 2014, Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site is hosting a Children’s Model Airplane Building Workshop in support of the Annual Labor Day Fly-In at Moton Field.   July 25, 2014  Tourism to Tuskegee National Parks Create Economic Benefit  TUSKEGEE, AL – A new National Park Service (NPS) report shows that 67,067 visitors to Tuskegee institute and Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Sites in 2013 spent $3,696,700 million in communities near the park. That spending supported 54 jobs in the local area.   June 21, 2014  2014 Junior Ranger Summer Camp  Tuskegee Institute and Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Sites invite children 5 – 12 years of age to attend Junior Ranger Summer Camp 2014.   October 22, 2013  Central Alabama National Parks Re-Open  Tuskegee Institute National Historic Site, Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site and Selma to Montgomery National Historic Trail Re-Opens to Visitors   June 21, 2013  Junior Ranger Summer Camp 2013 - “Get Out and Do Something”  Tuskegee Institute and Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Sites invite children 5 – 12 years of age to attend Junior Ranger Summer Camp 2013.   June 08, 2013  The Air Fields of the Tuskegee Airmen  This program will focus on various racially segregated Air Bases where the Tuskegee Airmen trained while preparing to fight in World War II. First learning how to fly J3 Piper Cubs at Kennedy Field, and then on to the PT-17 Stearman at Moton Field. From there, the Airmen would transfer to Tuskegee Army Air Field to receive training on more advanced aircraft like the BT-13 Valiant and the AT-6 Texan.   May 08, 2013  A Night under the Stars  On Saturday, May 18, 2013 at 7:30 p.m., Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site will host “A Night under the Stars” program at Moton Field   May 08, 2013  Parks Accepting Applications for the 2013 YCC Program  Join the Youth Conservation Corps (YCC) and become an important member of a cadre of dedicated individuals who work and play in the national parks.   April 11, 2013  Women in the Tuskegee Experience  On Saturday, April 13, 2013 at 10:00 a.m., 12:00 noon, and 2:00 p.m. the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site will host a special program entitled, “Women in the Tuskegee Experience.” This program will explore some of the many and varied roles women played in the Tuskegee Experience.   April 11, 2013  Minister Louis Farrakhan Visits Historic Site  The Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site is no stranger to visits from celebrities, dignitaries, and icons, making Saturday, March 23rd an honor to welcome Minister Louis Farrakhan of the Nation of Islam, his staff and the Mayor of Tuskegee, Johnny Ford.   March 09, 2013  Sunday Closures Due to the Sequestration Plan  TUSKEGEE, AL – Sequestration requires the National Park Service to take a five percent - $134 million – reduction in the funds expected and it must happen in the remaining seven month of this fiscal year.   March 02, 2013  National Historic Sites Tourism Creates Local Economic Benefit  Tuskegee Institute and Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Sites Tourism Creates $2,093,000 in Local Economic Benefit   March 02, 2013  Tuskegee University Air Force ROTC Students Volunteer  On Saturday, February 9, 2013, 13 Tuskegee University Air Force ROTC students volunteered their time and muscles to assist the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site with landscaping maintenance.   May 27, 2012  Tuskegee Airmen Volunteer Luncheon  On May 14, 2012 Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site recognized the valuable service of its Volunteers-in-Parks by hosting its Annual Volunteer Appreciation Luncheon at Moton Field.   April 22, 2012  Tuskegee Airmen Warrior Run  On April 14, 2012 Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site partnered with Tuskegee University and Tuskegee Airmen, Inc. to host the annual Tuskegee Airmen Warrior Run.   April 10, 2012  Milestone at Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site  A very special milestone has been reached at Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site.   April 06, 2012  National Park Service Youth Job Opportunity  Have you ever thought about spending your summer working and learning while having fun?  well, look further.   January 19, 2012  Red Tails Day at Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site  On Friday, January 20, historic Hangar One will be open from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and visitors will be able to roam the museum to learn about the Tuskegee Airmen.   February 21, 2010  Tuskegee Airmen Hangar Museum Open  Tuskegee Airmen Hangar #1 Museum Open Wednesday-Sunday   July 27, 2009  Fighting For Democracy: Who Are The "We" In "We, The People"?  The Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site is hosting a traveling exhibit entitled, Fighting For Democracy, Who Is The "We" In "We, The People"? from July 26, 2009 to January 10, 2010.   October 04, 2008  National Park Service opens Tuskegee Airmen Historic site  GRAND OPENING OF TUSKEGEE AIRMEN HISTORIC SITE HONORS NATION’S FIRST BLACK MILITARY AVIATORS Media Preview October 9   September 18, 2008  Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site Grand Opening October 10  Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site to celbrate Grand Opening October 10 through 12, 2008   December 19, 2007  National Historic Sites Close for Holidays  Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site, Tuskegee Institute National Historic Site, and Selma-to-Montgomery National Historic Trail will close for the holidays.   December 17, 2007  Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site Receives Grant  Milton M. Hopkins, Jr. Meteorologist Program begins in January 2008.   September 27, 2007  100th Fighter Squadron Activated  Tuskegee Airmen honored through activation of 100th Fighter Squadron   March 17, 2007  Tuskegee Airmen VIP Introduces VIP  Tuskegee Airmen Volunteer Introduces Senator Barak Obama   February 14, 2007  Milton M. Hopkins, Jr. Meteorologist Program  Tuskegee Institute Middle School Students Learn Meteorology   November 26, 2006  Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site Restoration  Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site Construction Update
